Horn|title=Adam Sandler|date=2006|publisher=Gareth Stevens|isbn=0836842340|page=[https://archive.org/details/adamsandler0000horn/page/17 17]|url=https://archive.org/details/adamsandler0000horn|url-access=registration|quote=adam sandler 1987 cosby show.|accessdate=April 22, 2018}}</ref> | occupation = {{Flat list| *[[Actor]] *[[comedian]] *[[screenwriter]] *[[film producer|producer]] *singer-songwriter}} | alma_mater = [[New York University]] | party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] | spouse = {{marriage|Jacqueline Titone|2003}} | children = 2 | signature = | module = {{Infobox comedian|embed=yes | medium = [[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]], [[film]], [[television]] | genre = | website = {{url|adamsandler.com}} }} }}
'''Adam Richard Sandler''' (born September 9, 1966) is an American actor, comedian, screenwriter, film producer, and singer-songwriter. After becoming a ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' cast member, he went on to star in many Hollywood feature films, which have combined grossed over $2 billion at the box office.<ref>{{cite web |title=People Index |url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/people/?view=Actor&sort=sumgross&p=.htm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326160457/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/people/?view=Actor&sort=sumgross&p=.htm |archive-date=26 March 2018 |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |access-date=28 January 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Adam Sandler |url=https://www.the-numbers.com/person/126870401-Adam-Sandler#tab=summary |publisher=[[The Numbers (website)|The Numbers]] |access-date=28 January 2020}}</ref>
Sandler is best known for his comedic roles including ''[[Billy Madison]]'' (1995), ''[[Happy Gilmore]]'' (1996), ''[[The Waterboy]]'' (1998), ''[[The Wedding Singer]]'' (1998), ''[[Big Daddy (1999 film)|Big Daddy]]'' (1999), ''[[Mr. Deeds]]'' (2002), ''[[50 First Dates]]'' (2004), ''[[The Longest Yard (2005 film)|The Longest Yard]]'' (2005), ''[[Click (2006 film)|Click]]'' (2006), ''[[Grown Ups (film)|Grown Ups]]'' (2010), ''[[Just Go with It]]'' (2011), ''[[Grown Ups 2]]'' (2013), ''[[Blended (film)|Blended]]'' (2014) and ''[[Murder Mystery (film)|Murder Mystery]]'' (2019). He also voices [[Count Dracula|Dracula]] in the [[Hotel Transylvania (franchise)|''Hotel Transylvania'' franchise]] (2012–present).
Some of his films, such as the widely panned ''[[Jack and Jill (2011 film)|Jack and Jill]]'', have been heavily criticized, culminating in a shared second place in the number of [[Golden Raspberry Awards]] (three) and Raspberry Award nominations (11), in both cases second only to [[Sylvester Stallone]].
Though he is associated predominantly with broad comedies, Sandler has consistently earned critical praise for his occasional dramatic performances in films such as ''[[Punch-Drunk Love]]'' (2002), ''[[Spanglish (film)|Spanglish]]'' (2004), ''[[Reign Over Me]]'' (2007), ''[[Funny People]]'' (2009), ''[[The Meyerowitz Stories|The Meyerowitz Stories (New and Selected)]]'' (2017), and ''[[Uncut Gems]]'' (2019).<ref>{{cite web|last=Cea|first=Max|url=https://www.salon.com/2017/10/12/noah-baumbach-performs-a-miracle-adam-sandler-doesnt-suck-in-the-meyerowitz-stories/|title=Noah Baumbach performs a miracle: Adam Sandler doesn't suck in 'The Meyerowitz Stories' |work=[[Salon (website)|Salon]] |date=October 12, 2017|accessdate=April 28, 2017}}</ref>
== Early life == Sandler was born in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]], on September 9, 1966,<ref name=filmref /><ref name=biography.com>{{cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/people/adam-sandler-9542505|title=Adam Sandler: Film Actor, Singer, Songwriter, Comedian, Screenwriter (1966–)|website=[[Biography.com]]|publisher=[[A&E Networks]]| accessdate=March 26, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Monitor|newspaper=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=September 13, 2013|issue=1276|pages=28}}</ref> to Judith "Judy" (née Levine), a nursery school teacher, and Stanley Sandler, an electrical engineer.<ref name="filmref">{{cite web| url = http://www.filmreference.com/film/70/Adam-Sandler.html |title=Adam Sandler Biography (1966?-)|publisher= FilmReference.com|accessdate=December 24, 2014 | quote=Full name, Adam Richard Sandler; born September 9, 1966 (some sources cite 1964)...}}</ref> His family is [[Jews|Jewish]] and descends from Russian Jewish immigrants on both sides.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://jewishjournal.com/opinion/rob_eshman/180474/|title=Adam Sandler: "I'm very pro-Israel"|last=Eshman|first=Rob|date=December 15, 2015|work=[[The Jewish Journal of Greater Los Angeles|Jewish Journal]]|accessdate=May 20, 2018|quote="I'm proud of being a Jew and that's what I am," Sandler said.}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/starsandstories/3709985/Adam-Sandler-this-ones-for-the-kids.html|title=Adam Sandler: this one's for the kids|last=Hiscock|first=John|date=December 11, 2008|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=July 30, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tabletmag.com/scroll/196117/adam-sandler-and-howard-stern-talk-jewish-shop|title= Adam Sandler and Howard Stern Talk Jewish Shop |first=Jonathan |last=Zalman |work=[[Tablet (magazine)|Tablet Magazine]]|date= December 22, 2015|accessdate= April 18, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/i-didnt-get-into-movies-to-please-the-critics-adam-sandler-interview-8742294.html|title= 'I didn't get into movies to please the critics': Adam Sandler interview |work=[[The Independent]]|first=Emma |last=Jones |date= August 2, 2013|accessdate= April 18, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Галина Галкина |url=http://www.golos-ameriki.ru/content/just-go-with-it-2011-03-21-118361894/224464.html |title=Притворный брак Адама Сэндлера и Дженнифер Энистон |website=Golos-ameriki.ru |date=March 21, 2011 |accessdate=June 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bh.org.il/blog-items/stars-of-david-10-jewish-hollywood-icons/|title=Let There Be Laughter – Jewish Humor Around the World|last=|first=|date=|website=Beit Hatfutsot|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=}}</ref> His [[patrilineal]] great-grandfather, Joseph Jacob Sandler, was born in [[Pagėgiai Municipality]], [[Tauragė County]], [[Lithuania]].<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.geni.com/people/Joseph-Sandler/6000000029081386829?through=6000000038200170005 | title=Joseph Jacob Sandler (1878 - 1952) | publisher=[[Geni.com]] | date=January 20, 2019 | accessdate=March 18, 2019}}</ref> Sandler grew up in [[Manchester, New Hampshire]], after moving there at the age of six.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unionleader.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/99999999/NEWHAMPSHIRE09/110429372/-1/newhampshire09|title=Adam Sandler|work=UnionLeader.com}}</ref> He attended [[Manchester Central High School]]. As a teen, Sandler was in [[BBYO]], a Jewish youth group. Sandler graduated from [[New York University]]'s [[Tisch School of the Arts]] in 1988.<ref>{{cite web| url= http://www.nyu.edu/alumni.magazine/issue10/10_culture_snl.html | title= Live From New York, It's... | publisher=[[New York University]] | work=NYU Alumni Magazine | date= Spring 2008 | accessdate=June 30, 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100530061407/http://www.nyu.edu/alumni.magazine/issue10/10_culture_snl.html| archivedate= May 30, 2010 | url-status= live}}</ref>
== Career ==
=== Acting career === [[File:Adamsandler(cannesPhotocall).jpg|thumb|Sandler at 2002 [[Cannes Film Festival]]]] Early in his career, in 1987, Sandler played [[Theo Huxtable]]'s friend, Smitty, in ''[[The Cosby Show]]'' and the Stud Boy or Trivia Delinquent in the [[Game show|MTV game show]] ''[[Remote Control (game show)|Remote Control]]''. After his film debut ''[[Going Overboard]]'' in 1989, Sandler performed in comedy clubs, having first taken the stage at his brother's urging when he was 17. He was discovered by comedian [[Dennis Miller]], who caught Sandler's act in Los Angeles and recommended him to ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' producer [[Lorne Michaels]]. Sandler was hired as a writer for ''SNL'' in 1990 and became a featured player the following year, making a name for himself by performing amusing original songs on the show, including "[[The Thanksgiving Song]]" and "[[The Chanukah Song]]".<ref name=biography.com/> Sandler told [[Conan O'Brien]] on ''[[The Tonight Show with Conan O'Brien|The Tonight Show]]'' that [[NBC]] fired him and [[Chris Farley]] from the show in 1995, and played this up in his return to the show as a host in 2019.<ref name="Sandler fired">{{cite news| url = http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/2010/01/21/2010-01-21_youre_not_alone_conan_obrien_adam_sandler_says_nbc_fired_him_and_chris_farley_fr.html | title= You're not alone, Conan O'Brien: Adam Sandler says NBC fired him and Chris Farley from 'SNL'| first= Joe |last=Dziemianowicz| work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]] | location=New York City |date= January 21, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Adam Sandler's "I Was Fired" Monologue - SNL |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eghK5yMpNuc |publisher=SNL}}</ref>
In 1993, Adam Sandler appeared in the film ''[[Coneheads (film)|Coneheads]]'' with Chris Farley, [[David Spade]], [[Dan Aykroyd]], [[Phil Hartman]], and [[Jane Curtin]]. In 1994, he co-starred in ''[[Airheads]]'' with [[Brendan Fraser]] and [[Steve Buscemi]]. He starred in ''[[Billy Madison]]'' (1995) playing a grown man repeating grades 1–12 to earn back his father's respect and the right to inherit his father's multimillion-dollar hotel empire. The film was successful at the box office despite negative reviews. He followed this film with ''[[Bulletproof (1996 film)|Bulletproof]]'' (1996), and the financially successful comedies ''Happy Gilmore'' (1996) and ''The Wedding Singer'' (1998). He was initially cast in the bachelor party–themed comedy/thriller ''[[Very Bad Things]]'' (1998) but had to back out due to his involvement in ''[[The Waterboy]]'' (1998), one of his first hits.
Although his earliest films did not receive favorable critical attention, he started to receive more positive reviews, beginning with ''Punch-Drunk Love'' in 2002. [[Roger Ebert]]'s review of ''Punch-Drunk Love'' concluded that Sandler had been wasted in earlier films with poorly written scripts and characters with no development.<ref>Ebert, Roger. [http://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20021018/REVIEWS/210180308/1023 "Punch-Drunk Love."] ''Chicago Sun-Times''. October 18, 2002.</ref> Sandler has moved outside the genre of slapstick comedy to take on more serious roles, such as the aforementioned ''[[Punch-Drunk Love]]'', for which he was nominated for a [[Golden Globe]], and [[Mike Binder]]'s ''[[Reign Over Me]]'' (2007), a drama about a man who loses his entire family during the [[September 11 attacks]], and then struggles to rekindle a friendship with his old college roommate ([[Don Cheadle]]).
He starred alongside friend [[Kevin James]] in the film ''[[I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry]]'' (2007), and headlined ''[[You Don't Mess with the Zohan]]'' (2008). The latter film was written by Sandler, [[Judd Apatow]], and [[Robert Smigel]], and directed by [[Dennis Dugan]].
[[File:Adam Sandler 6818.jpg|thumb|left|Sandler in [[Berlin]] in 2009]] Sandler starred along with [[Keri Russell]] and English comedian [[Russell Brand]] in [[Adam Shankman]]'s fantasy film ''[[Bedtime Stories (film)|Bedtime Stories]]'' (2008), as a stressed hotel maintenance worker whose bedtime stories he reads to his niece and nephew begin to come true. It marked as Sandler's first family film and first film under the [[The Walt Disney Company|Walt Disney]] banner.<ref>{{cite web| url = https://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=19719 |title=Adam Sandler's Bedtime Stories Come True| website=ComingSoon.net | date= April 4, 2007}}</ref>
In 2009, Sandler starred in Judd Apatow's third directorial feature ''[[Funny People]]''. The film was released on July 31, 2009.<ref>{{cite news | author=Michael Fleming | title = Trio joins Judd Apatow film |work=Variety | date = June 11, 2008 | url = https://www.variety.com/article/VR1117987337.html?categoryid=13&cs=1 | accessdate=June 13, 2008| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080709034441/http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117987337.html?categoryid=13&cs=1| archivedate=July 9, 2008| url-status= live}}</ref> Following the release of ''Funny People'', it, along with ''Punch-Drunk Love'' were cited in the June 2010 announcement that Sandler was one of 135 people (including 20 actors) invited to join the [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]].<ref>{{cite web| url= http://www.oscars.org/press/pressreleases/2010/20100625.html | title= Academy Invites 135 to Membership | publisher=[[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] | work=[[Press release]] | date= June 25, 2010 | location= Beverly Hills, CA | accessdate=June 29, 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100630164148/http://www.oscars.org/press/pressreleases/2010/20100625.html| archivedate= June 30, 2010 | url-status= live}}</ref>
Sandler appeared in ''[[Grown Ups (film)|Grown Ups]]'', alongside Kevin James, [[Chris Rock]], [[Rob Schneider]], and David Spade. Sandler and ''Dickie Roberts'' scribe Fred Wolf wrote the script and Dennis Dugan directed the film.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.variety.com/article/VR1117999951.html?categoryid=13&cs=1 | title = Columbia pic gets Sandler and friends |work=Variety | date = February 10, 2009 | accessdate=February 12, 2009 | first=Tatiana | last=Siegel| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090213130229/http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117999951.html?categoryid=13&cs=1| archivedate= February 13, 2009 | url-status= live}}</ref>
Sandler starred with [[Jennifer Aniston]] in the 2011 romantic comedy film ''[[Just Go with It]]''. Sandler also voiced a capuchin monkey in Kevin James's ''[[Zookeeper (film)|Zookeeper]]'', released on July 8, 2011. In 2012, he starred in ''[[That's My Boy (2012 film)|That's My Boy]]'', as a man who fathered a son ([[Andy Samberg]]) with his teacher in high school.
Sandler starred with [[Drew Barrymore]] in the [[Warner Bros.]] romantic comedy ''[[Blended (film)|Blended]]'', which was filmed in [[South Africa]], and was released on May 23, 2014.
In 2013, he guest starred in the [[Disney Channel Original Series]] ''[[Jessie (2011 TV series)|Jessie]]'' as himself. He and [[Cameron Boyce]] previously worked together in ''Grown Ups'' and ''[[Grown Ups 2]]''. The episode is titled "Punched Dumped Love". Sandler co-starred in the drama film ''[[Men, Women & Children (film)|Men, Women & Children]]'' (2014), directed by [[Jason Reitman]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Toronto: Jason Reitman Lining Up His Next Film|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/toronto-jason-reitman-lining-up-620958|accessdate=19 December 2013|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=September 4, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite press release|publisher=Paramount Pictures|title=Production Begins on Jason Reitman's Men, Women & Children|url=https://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=112527|accessdate=December 19, 2013|via=ComingSoon.net|date=December 16, 2013}}</ref> He was considered for the voice of Rocket Raccoon in Marvel's ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy (film)|Guardians of the Galaxy]]'' but [[Bradley Cooper]] was cast instead.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ifc.com/2013/01/jim-carrey-adam-sandler-guardians-of-the-galaxy| publisher=[[IFC (U.S. TV channel)|IFC]] | title= Jim Carrey and Adam Sandler Being Considered For "Guardians of the Galaxy"| accessdate= October 10, 2016}}</ref>
Sandler's recent comedy films, including ''Grown Ups'' and ''Grown Ups 2'', have received strongly negative reviews.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/grown-ups-2-best-lines-584676|title='Grown Ups 2': The Best Lines from the Worst Reviews|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=July 12, 2013|accessdate=May 27, 2016}}</ref> In reviewing the latter, critic Mark Olsen of ''[[The Los Angeles Times]]'' remarked that Sandler had become the antithesis of [[Judd Apatow]]; he was instead "the white [[Tyler Perry]]: smart enough to know better, savvy enough to do it anyway, lazy enough not to care."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-grown-ups-2-review-20130712-story.html|title='Review: 'Grown Ups 2' refuses to leave the sandbox|work=The Los Angeles Times|date=July 11, 2013|accessdate=May 27, 2016}}</ref>
In 2015, Sandler released his last theatrical film ''[[Pixels (2015 film)|Pixels]]'', based on French director Patrick Jean's [[Pixels (2010 film)|2010 short film of the same name]], before transitioning into a distribution deal with [[Netflix]]. His first original film for Netflix was the Western comedy film ''[[The Ridiculous 6]]''. Despite being universally panned by critics,<ref name="rotten">{{cite web |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_ridiculous_six/ |title= The Ridiculous Six (2015) |website=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=December 15, 2015}}</ref> on January 6, 2016, it was announced by Netflix that the film had been viewed more times in 30 days than any other movie in Netflix history.<ref>[https://variety.com/2016/film/news/adam-sandlers-ridiculous-six-is-making-history-for-netflix-1201673572 Adam Sandle'’s 'Ridiculous Six' Is Making History for Netflix] ''Variety.com''.</ref> He released three additional films on Netflix between 2016 and 2018: ''[[The Do-Over]]'', ''[[Sandy Wexler]]'' and ''[[The Week Of]]''.
He returned to dramatic territory in 2017 with ''[[The Meyerowitz Stories]]'', with his performance receiving favorable notices from critics.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.salon.com/2017/10/12/noah-baumbach-performs-a-miracle-adam-sandler-doesnt-suck-in-the-meyerowitz-stories/|title=Noah Baumbach performs a miracle: Adam Sandler doesn't suck in "The Meyerowitz Stories"|work=[[Salon (website)|Salon]]|date=October 12, 2017|accessdate=October 14, 2017}}</ref>
On May 4, 2019, Sandler made his first appearance as host of SNL, ending the episode with a tribute to his friend and fellow former cast member [[Chris Farley]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/snl-adam-sandler-hosts-first-time-pays-tribute-chris-farley-1207490|title='SNL': Adam Sandler Hosts For First Time, Pays Tribute to Chris Farley|website=The Hollywood Reporter|language=en|access-date=2019-05-05}}</ref>
In December 2019, Sandler starred in the crime thriller drama ''[[Uncut Gems]]'', directed by the [[Safdie brothers]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Adam Sandler Shows Off His Acting Chops In ‘Uncut Gems’ Trailer |url=https://digg.com/video/adam-sandler-uncut-gems-trailer |publisher=Digg |accessdate=25 September 2019}}</ref> The movie and Sandler's acting received acclaim and many end of year awards from critics, who noted this role as a career best for Sandler.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/reviews/uncut-gems-review-adam-sandler-safdie-brothers-cast-director-a9276151.html|title='Uncut Gems review: The best performance of Adam Sandler’s career'|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=15 January 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2019/10/04/uncut-gems-review-the-best-movie-of-adam-sandlers-career/|title=‘Uncut Gems’ review: The best movie of Adam Sandler’s career|publisher=New York Post|accessdate=15 January 2020}}</ref>
=== Happy Madison Productions === [[File:Adam Sandler (cropped).jpg|thumb|Sandler at a press conference for ''[[Click (2006 film)|Click]]'' in 2005]] Sandler formed his film production company, [[Happy Madison Productions]],<ref name="happy">[http://www.adamsandler.com/index.php?section=happy "Happy Madison."] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20051118222008/http://www.adamsandler.com/index.php?section=happy |date=November 18, 2005 }} AdamSandler.com. Accessed October 9, 2008.</ref> in 1999, first producing fellow ''SNL'' alumnus [[Rob Schneider]]'s film ''[[Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo]]''. The company has produced most of Sandler's subsequent films to date. The majority of the company's films have received negative reviews from critics, with three considered to be among the [[List of films considered the worst|worst ever made]]<ref>[https://www.metacritic.com/feature/adam-sandler-all-films-considered Adam Sandler: All Films Considered] Metacritic. Accessed April 21, 2015.</ref> yet most have performed well at box office.
Others who frequently appear in Sandler films include [[David Spade]], [[Kevin James]], [[Steve Buscemi]], [[Chris Rock]], [[John Turturro]], [[Peter Dante]], [[Allen Covert]], [[Jonathan Loughran]], and [[Jon Lovitz]].
In 2014, Netflix announced a four-movie deal with Adam Sandler and Happy Madison Productions.<ref>{{Cite web|title = With Four New Adam Sandler Films, Netflix Takes Aim at Theaters - NYTimes.com|url = http://mobile.nytimes.com/2014/10/02/business/media/with-four-new-adam-sandler-films-netflix-takes-aim-at-theaters.html|website = mobile.nytimes.com|accessdate = 2015-12-13}}</ref>
The company is located on the Sony/[[Columbia Pictures]] lot in [[Culver City, California]].
==Public image== Sandler has been referenced multiple times in various media, including in the TV shows ''[[The Simpsons]]'' in the episode "[[Monty Can't Buy Me Love]]",<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://bbc.adactio.com/cult/simpsons/episodeguide/season10/page20.shtml|title=Monty Can't Buy Me|website=[[BBC Online]]|date=September 2005|access-date=August 11, 2017}}</ref> in ''[[Family Guy]]'' in the episode "[[Stew-Roids]]",<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ign.com/articles/2009/04/27/family-guy-stew-roids-review|title=Family Guy: "Stew-Roids" Review|website=[[IGN]]|first=Ahsan|last=Haque|date=April 27, 2009|access-date=August 11, 2017}}</ref> and in ''[[South Park]]'' in the episode "[[You're Getting Old]]".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://entertainment.time.com/2011/06/09/south-park-watch-the-tao-of-poo/|title=South Park Watch: The Tao of Poo|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |first=James|last=Poniewozik|date=June 9, 2011|access-date=August 11, 2017}}</ref> He was also referenced in the video game ''[[Half-Life: Opposing Force]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.vgfacts.com/trivia/6729/|title=Half-Life: Opposing Force|publisher=[[Did You Know Gaming?#VGFacts|VGFacts]]|author="RetroRex"|access-date=August 11, 2017|quote=There is a hidden message on the upper skybox texture in the V-22 osprey g-man sequence. It reads "HACK HACK HACK ALL DAY LONG. HACK HACK HACK WHILE I SING THIS SONG". This is a reference to the Adam Sandler song "The Beating Of A High School Janitor.}}</ref> The [[HBO]] series ''[[Animals (U.S. TV series)|Animals]]'' episode "The Trial" features a mock court case to decide whether Sandler or [[Jim Carrey]] is a better comedian.
==Personal life== On <!--Sunday--> June 22, 2003, Sandler married model-actress Jacqueline Titone.<ref name=married>{{cite news|url=https://siouxcityjournal.com/entertainment/adam-sandler-marries-model-actress-jackie-titone/article_268844b3-7fc8-5d98-af1c-36ff72ea3bdd.html|title=Adam Sandler marries model-actress Jackie Titone|agency=[[Associated Press]]|work=[[Sioux City Journal]]|date=<!--Tuesday-->June 24, 2003|accessdate=March 26, 2019|archivedate=March 26, 2019|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20190326152430/https://siouxcityjournal.com/entertainment/adam-sandler-marries-model-actress-jackie-titone/article_268844b3-7fc8-5d98-af1c-36ff72ea3bdd.html|url-status=live|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Titone had [[Conversion to Judaism|converted]] to Sandler's religion, Judaism.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/nydn-features/numbers-drew-adam-article-1.643235 |title=By The Numbers Drew & Adam |work=New York Daily News |date=February 17, 2004 |accessdate=January 29, 2013}}</ref> She makes frequent appearances in her husband's films. The couple have two daughters, Sadie born in May 2006,<ref>{{cite web|last=Wihlborg |first=Ulrica|url=https://people.com/celebrity/adam-sandler-wife-have-a-baby/|title=Adam Sandler, Wife Have a Baby|work=People|date=May 7, 2006|accessdate=February 3, 2019}}</ref> and Sunny born in November 2008,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/domesticNews/idUSTRE4AB18Q20081112|title=Adam Sandler and wife have second daughter|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 12, 2008|accessdate=February 3, 2018}}</ref> who also make frequent appearances in his films.
Sandler is a supporter of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Adam Sandler’s Religion and Political Views |url=https://hollowverse.com/adam-sandler/ |website=hollowverse.com |accessdate=31 December 2019}}</ref> In 2007, Sandler made a $1 million donation to the [[Boys & Girls Clubs of America]] in his hometown, [[Manchester, New Hampshire]].<ref>[http://www.newhampshire.com/nh-people/adam-sandler-biography.aspx "Adam Sandler donates $1 million to Manchester charity."] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100818203545/http://www.newhampshire.com/nh-people/adam-sandler-biography.aspx |date=August 18, 2010 }} newhampshire.com.</ref> The same year, he donated $2,100 to former [[New York City]] mayor [[Rudy Giuliani]]'s [[Rudy Giuliani presidential campaign, 2008|presidential campaign]].
